data.event: The county was organized December 15, 1826 and named for President Andrew Jackson (elected 1828).
The county was organized December 15, 1826 and named for President Andrew Jackson (elected 1828).

event.title: the British victory in the French and Indian War in 1763

data.event: Jackson County was a part of New France, until the British victory in the French and Indian War in 1763 resulted in the cession of this territory to Great Britain's ally, Spain.

event.title: was forced by the Third Treaty of San Ildefonso in 1800

data.event: Spain was forced by the Third Treaty of San Ildefonso in 1800 to return its Louisiana Territory (of which modern Jackson County then formed a part) to France, which in turn sold it to the United States in the Louisiana Purchase of 1803.

event.title: sold it to the United States in the Louisiana Purchase of 1803

data.event: Spain was forced by the Third Treaty of San Ildefonso in 1800 to return its Louisiana Territory (of which modern Jackson County then formed a part) to France, which in turn sold it to the United States in the Louisiana Purchase of 1803.
